page.title: 06The Landscape In Ashby
page.content: This is a description of one square (5667) measuring one kilometre by one kilometre .It consists mainly of farmland used for arable .There are two small springs in this area. There is a road to Kilsby coming from Daventry .On the left hand side there are four fields:they grow wheat, peas, wheat and wheat.On the right-hand side of the road are four fields for wheat, grazing, barley and barley. The springs are in the fields and are just like small streams. There is just one building which is called the Cottage.It is large, with a garden of one acre, but it does not have any farmland.
